Regime-Specific Macro Themes

CoT regime-specific macro themes: inflation, slowdown, supply stress, disinflation.

As of 2026-01-06

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The 1 signal currently flags a "Supply_Stress" regime as of the latest observation on 2026-01-06.
  • This indicates potential physical market tightness or disruptions in energy and agricultural commodities, while other macro themes remain inactive.
  • Conviction Band: Medium, Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence, Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The "Supply_Stress" theme is driven by commercial hedgers deeply long in Energy futures, with a 0.222222 share exceeding the 0.20 threshold (1).
  • This signals physical shortage or consumption risk hedging. No Inflation Impulse, Disinflation, or Global Slowdown themes are active.
  • Conditional Invalidation: The "Supply_Stress" signal would reverse if the deeply long hedger share in Energy or Ags drops below 0.20 (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Supply Stress persists due to continued physical market tightness or hedging activity.
  • Upside secondary: An Inflation Impulse theme could emerge with increased speculative longs and producer hedging in Energy and Metals.
  • Downside residual: A Global Slowdown could emerge if metals see crowded shorts alongside a broad risk-off tone.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Tactical (weeks), reflecting weekly CoT data and immediate positioning shifts.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium, due to its clear indication of market pressure, but limited to one macro theme.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Pricing, supply/demand balance, and potential inflation pressures in physical markets.
  • Cycle position: This signal can manifest across early, mid, or late cycles depending on specific commodity market conditions.
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: Often correlates with higher commodity prices and may precede or reinforce inflation signals (2).

Data & References:

  • `df_cot_signals` (sector-level aggregation), latest observation date: 2026-01-06.
  • The `hedger_deep_long_share` for Energy (0.222222) was most influential for the current state (1).
  • Additional public datasets: Producer Price Index (PPI) and Consumer Price Index (CPI) (2), and global Purchasing Managers' Indices (PMI) (3).
